Hello  I live with my grandparent too and while she doesn't display aggressive behaviour  she does get quite upset when things are not in the right place and when we don't follow her requests. She will mumble and go on and onIt can be quite frustrating especially if you're in the middle of something and can't attend to them.What I've learned is that sometimes behaviours are ways of communication. May want to observe what are the antecedents or triggers before the observed behaviour and see if you can see a pattern and react better  might even understand why numbers are so important to him. It also helps when I practise empathy and when he reacts  always let him cool down so long he doesnt hurt himself or others.Services  diagnosis are also great options to consider.
